availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison H. Hurt (Clinton County, Kentucky, student and Captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Clinton County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Son of Reuben Hurt and Anna Hurt. Resident in Wayne County, Kentucky in 1850. At school in Clinton County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain. Served in 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as Captain starting December 23, 1863. Promoted to Major of the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry in 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 299. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 623. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 360. Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, 1773-2007, U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, Series Number T288. Find A Grave, "Harrison M. Hurt (September 10, 1840-January 25, 1927)," Memorial #2692147, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26929147 (accessed January 17, 2020).
